definitions.definition: Supposing that, assuming that, in the circumstances that; used to introduce a condition that may be (or prove to be) either true or false.
examples: If crossing the road, make sure you look both ways.
If I give you the money would/will you buy it for me?
If you prefer, I can come tomorrow instead.
I'll, if I have time, do it next week.
I'll come only if you will do the driving.
Fetch me a cold beer if there's one in the fridge.

subdefinitions.definition: A keyword that invokes conditional processing: in the event that a given condition is true, execute the given statement(s) (otherwise execute other statements).
examples: if A then B else C

definitions.definition: Supposing that; used with past or past perfect subjunctive to indicate a counterfactual or hypothetical condition.
examples: If she hadn't told me, I wouldn't know.
"You would be healthier if you would give up smoking" "Well, if I were rich, I'd go to one of those hypnosis therapies to quit".

subdefinitions.definition: Even if; even in the circumstances that.
examples: I wouldn't marry you if you were the last man on earth.
You're finishing your chowder if you sit there all afernoon!

definitions.definition: Considering the fact that; given that ; introducing a condition that is known to be true .
examples: The drain's blocked — and if the drain's blocked, the water won't flow.
If you heat water to 100° C, it boils.

definitions.definition: Although ; used to introduce a concession ; may..but.
examples: He was a great friend, if a little stingy at the bar.
She won her team's admiration, if not the award, for her performance.

definitions.definition: Whether ; used to introduce a noun clause, an indirect question, that functions as the direct object of certain verbs.
Introducing a relevance conditional ; in case.
examples: I have leftover cake if you want some.
If you want to go home, I have the car keys.

main_definition: Supposing that, assuming that, in the circumstances that; used to introduce a condition that may be (or prove to be) either true or false.
secondary_definitions: Supposing that; used with past or past perfect subjunctive to indicate a counterfactual or hypothetical condition.
Considering the fact that; given that ; introducing a condition that is known to be true .
Although ; used to introduce a concession ; may..but.
( sometimes proscribed ) Whether ; used to introduce a noun clause, an indirect question, that functions as the direct object of certain verbs.
Introducing a relevance conditional ; in case.
